channel.title: My first Linux VPS
channel.description:
I recently purchased a new Linux VPS.
I loaded my server's source onto the VPS, but I cannot find out how to execute the server and turn it on.
I have read several tutorials, but they include commands like "yum" which do not work with PuTTy when I try them. I don't know how to download Java onto my VPS. I really need to know how to start my server and get java working so I can continue coding my server. I really need help. I have been messing with this thing for about 3 hours now, I have gotten nowhere.
This is a RSPS server.
What I am basically asking: --
- Help me understand how to get Java onto my Linux VPS - Help me understand how to start/stop/restart my server using PuTTy

item.title: My first Linux VPS
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

So it turns out that some vps providers remove yum from their centos installations.

http://wiki.centos.org/TipsAndTricks/BrokenVserver#head-422253b167db0be28778633f1a0c8d2b70c7958b

You’ll need to inquire with your vps provider about whatever package management system they may have in place.

Alternatively you could try and install it directly from the .rpm: http://wiki.openscg.com/index.php/OpenJDK_RPM_Installation

Read full topic

item.title: My first Linux VPS
item.dc:creator: @zosai zosai
item.description:
@zosai wrote:

root@######:~# su -c "yum install java-1.6.0-openjdk" bash: yum: command not found

Read full topic

item.title: My first Linux VPS
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

:S Probably not a great idea to be using Centos if you’re a beginner, but I guess the experience is good.

You could use openjdk, which can be installed by executing su -c "yum install java-1.6.0-openjdk"

Read full topic

item.title: My first Linux VPS
item.dc:creator: @zosai zosai
item.description:
@zosai wrote:

Ollie123:

Which distro is the VPS running? Centos?

Yes, Centos.

Read full topic
